DataElement.preferredName: Index Prostate Biopsy Order Reason Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Records the reason the index prostate biopsy was ordered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Index; a numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number._A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. (NCI-GLOSS)_Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body._A logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Index; a numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number.:A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. (NCI-GLOSS)

Concepts.definition: A numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number; a number used to select an element of a list, vector, array or other sequence.

The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

Property.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:A logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
A logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements; a condition of regular or proper arrangement.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The text term that records the reason the index prostate biopsy was ordered.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia characterized by the presence of morphologically malignant cells lining the acini and ducts. The malignant cells are enlarged, contain prominent nucleoli, and have increased nuclear/cytoloplasmic ratio. The malignant cells may grow within the ducts and acini in four architectural patterns: flat, tufting, micropapillary, and cribriform. The presence of high grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia in needle biopsy is a risk factor for the subsequent detection of carcinoma on repeat biopsy.

Concepts.definition: Prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia characterized by the presence of morphologically malignant cells lining the acini and ducts.  The malignant cells are enlarged, contain prominent nucleoli, and have increased nuclear/cytoplasmic ratio.  The malignant cells may grow within the ducts and acini in four architectural patterns: flat, tufting, micropapillary, and cribriform.  The presence of high grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia in needle biopsy is a risk factor for the subsequent detection of carcinoma on repeat biopsy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Family; a domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.: The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.: A benign or malignant tumor involving the prostate gland. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.
The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.

A benign, borderline, or malignant neoplasm that affects the prostate gland.  Representative examples include benign prostate phyllodes tumor, prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia, prostate carcinoma, and prostate sarcoma.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Atypical Small Acinar Proliferation of the Prostate Gland

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Atypical Small Acinar Proliferation of the Prostate Gland
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Focal proliferation of small acinar glandular cells in the prostate gland with cytologic changes ranging from atypia to highly suggestive of malignancy.

Concepts.longName: Atypical Small Acinar Proliferation of the Prostate Gland
Concepts.definition: Focal proliferation of small acinar glandular cells in the prostate gland with cytologic changes ranging from atypia to highly suggestive of malignancy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Increase; a process of becoming larger or more numerous or more important.: Alternate isoforms of the single-chain 261-aa 30-kD Kallikrein 3 (Prostate Specific Antigen) glycoprotein precursor are encoded by human KLK3 Gene (Kallikrein Family). Frameshifted isoform 2 has a shorter distinct C-terminus. A serine protease in seminal plasma, PSA may function in liquefaction of seminal coagulum by (preferential Tyr-X) cleavage of seminal vesicle protein. Kallikrein proteases have diverse functions. Mounting evidence implicates kallikreins in carcinogenesis; some have potential as cancer biomarkers. The serum level of PSA is useful in diagnosis and monitoring of prostatic carcinoma. (from LocusLink, Swiss-Prot, OMIM, and NCI)

Concepts.definition: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.
Prostate-specific antigen (261 aa, ~29 kDa) is encoded by the human KLK3 gene. This protein plays a role in both proteolysis and seminal fluid liquefaction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Deviating from the norm.: Alternate isoforms of the single-chain 261-aa 30-kD Kallikrein 3 (Prostate Specific Antigen) glycoprotein precursor are encoded by human KLK3 Gene (Kallikrein Family). Frameshifted isoform 2 has a shorter distinct C-terminus. A serine protease in seminal plasma, PSA may function in liquefaction of seminal coagulum by (preferential Tyr-X) cleavage of seminal vesicle protein. Kallikrein proteases have diverse functions. Mounting evidence implicates kallikreins in carcinogenesis; some have potential as cancer biomarkers. The serum level of PSA is useful in diagnosis and monitoring of prostatic carcinoma. (from LocusLink, Swiss-Prot, OMIM, and NCI): The amount of something per unit size.

Concepts.definition: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.
Prostate-specific antigen (261 aa, ~29 kDa) is encoded by the human KLK3 gene. This protein plays a role in both proteolysis and seminal fluid liquefaction.
The amount of something per unit size.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Deviating from the norm.: PSA circulates in the blood in two forms: free or attached to a protein molecule.  With benign prostate conditions, there is more free PSA, while cancer produces more of the attached form.  A more accurate predictor of cancer than either a patient's age or his total PSA level. (from Cancer Information Service)

Concepts.definition: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.

PSA circulates in the blood in two forms: free or attached to a protein molecule.  With benign prostate conditions, there is more free PSA, while cancer produces more of the attached form.  A more accurate predictor of cancer than either a patient's age or his total PSA level. (from Cancer Information Service)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: High; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.: Alternate isoforms of the single-chain 261-aa 30-kD Kallikrein 3 (Prostate Specific Antigen) glycoprotein precursor are encoded by human KLK3 Gene (Kallikrein Family). Frameshifted isoform 2 has a shorter distinct C-terminus. A serine protease in seminal plasma, PSA may function in liquefaction of seminal coagulum by (preferential Tyr-X) cleavage of seminal vesicle protein. Kallikrein proteases have diverse functions. Mounting evidence implicates kallikreins in carcinogenesis; some have potential as cancer biomarkers. The serum level of PSA is useful in diagnosis and monitoring of prostatic carcinoma. (from LocusLink, Swiss-Prot, OMIM, and NCI)

Concepts.definition: An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.
Prostate-specific antigen (261 aa, ~29 kDa) is encoded by the human KLK3 gene. This protein plays a role in both proteolysis and seminal fluid liquefaction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: High; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.: This gene may be involved in prostate cancer.: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.
This gene may be involved in prostate cancer.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Deviating from the norm.: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.: A collection of facts from which conclusions may be drawn.

Concepts.definition: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.
Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.
A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Deviating from the norm.: Digital rectal examination.  An examination in which a doctor inserts a lubricated, gloved finger into the rectum to feel for abnormalities.: Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.

An examination that checks for abnormalities of organs or other structures in the pelvis and lower abdomen. During a digital rectal exam, a health professional inserts a lubricated, gloved finger of one hand into the rectum and may use the other hand to press on the lower abdomen or pelvic area.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Taking part in an activity.: The systematic collection, analysis, and interpretation of health data on an ongoing basis.

Concepts.definition: Exerting influence or producing an effect.
The systematic collection, analysis, and interpretation of health data on an ongoing basis.

The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.
